result.execSummary:
The defendant John J. Hix-Peden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Consecutive to 12CF669.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharges unless previously provided and paid.
May not have contact with known felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days will be determined by DOC and be based upon actual release date.  Release to be effectuated within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

records.addlTxt: Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 4 years WSP consecutive to 12CF669:  2 years initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP.
With Atty Celebre the SEHR of 6/12/17 at 1:15pm is rescheduled; as the deft was sent to Dodge on 5/30 and there is not time to have him produced on a writ by then; reset to 6/19/17 at 1:15pm.

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 5/19/17; to be returned to court for sentencing.  $498.95 in unpaid court financial obligations.

Revocation packet.

At the request of DOC Agt Adam Lucht a SEHR is set for 6/12/17 at 1:15pm.
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Pecora.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions, concurrent to 12CF669; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.

With Atty Pecora, ADA McNeill and by approval of the court the FPT of 3/25/15 at 9:30am is rescheduled, as the deft was not writted for this hearing; also the case is resolved; PLEAH set for 5/6/15 at 9:30am.
With Peggy/Atty Pecora the FPT of 2/11/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty Pecora will be unavailable on that date; reset to 3/25/15 at 9:30am.
With Amy/Atty Pecora the FPT of 1/20/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, to be heard after deft's revocation hearing on 1/29/15; reset to 2/11/15 at 1:15pm.
